#summary Getting started with GDataCopier 3.0.

= Installation =

== Requirements ==

  * Python 2.6+
  * [http://code.google.com/p/gdata-python-client/downloads/list GData Client Library] 2.0.16+ (Ubuntu users please ensure you have the right version).
  * Ability to establish HTTPS connections, check if you are using Proxies.
  * [http://pypi.python.org/pypi/keyring Python Keyring], available via easy_install or PIP.

Was developed and tested under OS X, tested under Linux. If you are using Windows and find any issues please report it to us.

= Authentication =

These will be stored in the user's [http://pypi.python.org/pypi/keyring Keyring]. Please note you will need Keyring support installed, generally available by default on OS X, Linux and Windows.

== Obtaining credentials ==

You will require to register GDataCopier with Google's [https://code.google.com/apis/console/ API Console]. 

  * Head to [https://code.google.com/apis/console/ Google's API Console]
  * Click on API access
  * Create Client ID
  * Choose Installed Application
  * Click create

You will require the

  * Client ID
  * Consumer Secret

== Logging In ==

Setting these values in GDataCopier, repeat any number of times to reset the values. Note username is the default username, this can be changed per command as a parameter

{{{
gdc login -c your-client-id -s your-client-secret -u optional-default-username
}}}

{{{
gdc login --client-id your-client-id --client-secret your-client-secret --username optional-default-username
}}}

== Logging Out ==

{{{
gdc logout
}}}
